official-title.#text: To reform and update the flat rent structure for public housing.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Fair Local Adjustment for Tenant Rents Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fair Local Adjustment for Tenant Rents Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended to read as follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Clause (i) of section 3(a)(2)(B) of the United States Housing Act of 1937

text.#text:
be based on the rental value of the unit, as determined by the public housing agency, but may not
			 be an amount that is less than 80 percent of the applicable fair market
			 rental established under
be established using another factor as determined by the

Each public housing agency shall establish, for each dwelling unit in public housing owned or
			 operated by the agency, a flat rental amount for the dwelling unit, which
			 shall—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may establish a flat rent for a dwelling in
			 an amount that is less than the minimum amount established pursuant to
			 subclause (I) for the unit, if the public housing agency demonstrates that
			 such minimum amount is not an accurate measure of the rental value for the
			 unit.

text.#text: A public housing agency may request that the

If a new flat rental amount established pursuant to this clause for a dwelling unit would increase
			 the existing rental payment of any family residing in public housing as of
			 implementation of such flat rent by more than 35 percent, the new flat
			 rental amount shall be phased in as necessary to ensure that the family’s
			 existing rental payment does not increase by more than 35 percent
			 annually.
